original_title: Sri Lanka power, energy unions accept pay hike minus bonuses, benefits: minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Power & Energy has entered collective agreements with trade unions of the state-run Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) and Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) for a 25-percent salary increment every three years minus annual bonuses, allowances and other benefits.
Power & Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara tweeted Friday March 10 evening that the bonuses, allowances and other benefits will not be continued or renewed.
“I have instructed Secretary to the Min of Power & Energy to commence the process to terminate them,” he said.

Collective agreements entered with Trade unions of CEB & CPC for 25% salary increment every 3 years, annual bonuses, allowances & other benefits will not be continued or renewed. I have instructed Secretary to the Min of Power & Energy to commence the process to terminate them.
